intro: Artabotrys tanaosriensis, commonly known as the Malabar starfruit, is a flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Annonaceae family and is characterized by its fragrant, star-shaped flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces a small, yellow, star-shaped fruit that is edible and has a citrus-like flavor. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
